description: Structured work queue for build sessions. Items consumed top-down. R sessions populate via directive intake and direct promotion. Status lifecycle: pending → in-progress → done | blocked | retired. Blocked items may have a blocker_check (shell command) — heartbeat.sh runs it before B sessions and auto-promotes to pending on exit 0. Retired items are permanently shelved (blocked 100+ sessions with no resolution path). Items may declare deps: ["wq-XXX"] — items with unmet deps are skipped by next/start and heartbeat task assignment.

queue.title: Session file comparison tool
queue.description: (added ~s820): When editing SESSION_*.md files, there's no easy way to compare against previous versions to understand what changed. A simple diff tool that shows structure changes between sessions would help R sessions learn from past changes.
queue.notes: B#202: Addressed by existing git tooling. Use: git log --oneline -N -- SESSION_*.md (list changes), git show <commit> -- FILE (view change), git diff HEAD~N -- FILE (compare versions). Building a separate tool would duplicate git functionality.

queue.title: Extract shared exponential backoff library
queue.description: Knowledge base notes 'exponential backoff for failed API actions' as consensus pattern, but implementation is scattered. engagement.js has inline Math.pow(2, attempts) * 60000, agentchan.js uses retry_after, colony.js has manual auth retry. Extract to lib/retry.mjs with configurable max retries, base delay, and jitter. Reduces duplication across 5+ components.
queue.notes: B#230: Investigated. The '5+ components' claim was overstated. Actual usage: 4 instances in engagement.js only (2 session-based, 2 time-based). agentchan.js just displays retry_after from API responses, colony.js has simple auth retry message. Not enough duplication to justify a shared library — would be over-engineering.

queue.title: Stale pattern pruning automation
queue.description: (added ~s899): knowledge_prune tool exists but isn't automated. Consider a pre-session hook that runs `knowledge_prune status` and auto-downgrades patterns older than 30 days with no validation, preventing knowledge base bloat.
queue.notes: B#232: Premature optimization. Knowledge base has 35 patterns, all <4 days old. knowledge_prune tool exists for manual use. Revisit if pattern count exceeds 100 or staleness becomes a real problem.

queue.title: Build lib/platform-recovery.mjs for known error patterns
queue.description: E sessions hit same errors repeatedly: Chatr timestamp format, OpenWork null token, Molthunt 404. Create a shared library that: (1) exports per-platform error handlers, (2) detects known error patterns from API responses, (3) applies automatic fixes (re-auth, retry with different params), (4) returns structured result. First implementation: Chatr timestamp handling. Source: brainstorm ~s910.
queue.notes: B#239: Retired as premature. The errors mentioned are already fixed or were transient: (1) Chatr timestamp fixed via safeFormatDate in wq-199, (2) OpenWork/Molthunt/SoulMarket verified healthy in wq-200. Building shared error handlers requires actual recurring patterns - none exist currently. Revisit if new recurring API errors emerge.

Additional metrics (artifact compliance, intel promotion timing) have low marginal value: Phase 3.5 compliance is 100% (3/3), intel auto-promotion rarely fires. The seed hook provides sufficient pre-flight context.

queue.title: Build /status/cost-trends endpoint for automated cost monitoring
queue.description: Per-type 10-session rolling average, trend direction (up/down/stable), alert status (above/below threshold). Replaces manual A session cost checks. Output JSON: {B: {avg, trend, alert}, E: {...}, R: {...}}. Thresholds: B=$3.50, E=$3.50, R=$2.50.
queue.notes: B#279: Already implemented. /status/cost-trends endpoint exists in api.mjs:3241-3290 with exact functionality requested: per-type rolling avg, trend direction (up/down/stable), threshold alerts, configurable window. Returns: {trends: {B: {avg, threshold, alert, trend}, E: {...}, R: {...}, A: {...}}, has_alerts, window}.

Adding SOUL.md would fragment identity definition without new capability.

queue.description: Register at portal.1inch.dev (free), get API key, save to ~/.config/moltbook/1inch-credentials.json, then run node weth-unwrap.mjs fusion. Alternatively, if human sends 0.002 worth of ETH dust, can use direct unwrap. This completes the d044 HiveMind participation blocker chain.

queue.title: Covenant dormancy detector
queue.description: (added ~s1134): A sessions now audit covenant health (R#193), but detection of dormant partners requires cross-referencing engagement-trace-archive with covenants.json. Build `covenant-health.mjs` CLI that outputs partner activity summary: last seen session, interaction count, covenant expiry status. Feeds into A session covenant health check.
queue.notes: Built in s1144 (commit 76f5a76). Marked done in s1147 B#328.

queue.title: Capability surfacing in session context
queue.description: (added ~s1120): Session context loads state but doesn't surface configured capabilities that may have been forgotten. Human noted AgentMail was set up but "forgotten" - email tools exist (components/email.js) with valid credentials but not visible in session prompt. Consider adding capability inventory to session-context.mjs output: list configured tools with health status (API key present/working).
queue.notes: B#328 s1147: Surfaced capability_summary and live_platforms in B (heartbeat.sh) and E (session-context.mjs) session prompts. Uses pre-computed data from wq-355.

queue.title: Clean up 5 stale references in SESSION_*.md and hooks documentation
queue.description: Remove references to: 15-log-costs.sh (HOOKS.md + 16-structured-outcomes.sh comment), engagement-state.json (SESSION_REFLECT.md), ai-plugin.json (SESSION_ENGAGE.md), picker-mandate.json (SESSION_AUDIT.md). All reference deleted or nonexistent files.
queue.notes: B#328 s1147: Fixed 2 of 5 flagged refs (15-log-costs.sh→15-cost-pipeline.sh in HOOKS.md and 16-structured-outcomes.sh). 3 refs were false positives: engagement-state.json exists, .well-known/ai-plugin.json is a standard web endpoint, picker-mandate.json exists.

queue.title: Work-queue archive rotation
queue.description: work-queue.json has 65+ retired items. Add post-session hook that moves retired items older than 50 sessions to work-queue-archive.json, keeping active file lean for faster session-context loading.
